sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SYDEROPŒCILUS, in natural hiſtory, the name of a ſtone mentioned by the ancients. It was found in Arabia, and ſeems to have obtained this name from its being ſpotted with a ferruginous colour. The deſcriptions of the ancients are, however, in this, as in many other inſtances, too ſhort to ſuffer us to gueſs what ſtone they meant.— This might poſſibly be a granite with ſpots of this peculiar colour.
